Package org.pvv.shufflegene

Class DinucleotideShuffle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pvv.shufflegene.DinucleotideShuffle
  • public class DinucleotideShuffle
extends java.lang.Object
    Shuffle a nucleotide sequence, retaining its dinucleotide (2-mer) frequencies. This is based on the algorithm by Altschul and Erickson, as described in https://doi.org/10.1093/oxfordjournals.molbev.a040370

    It does the following:

    • Decomposes the sequence into a graph with nodes at the nucleotides ACGT and the sequence as a series of directed edges
    • Randomly selects a directed path which visits all nodes exactly ones, is connected, and ends at the final letter in the original sequence. Remove this path from the graph
    • Shuffles the ordering of all other edges in the graph on a per-node basis
    • Appends the previously removed path to the end of the vertices leaving each node

      • shuffleSequence

        public static java.lang.String shuffleSequence​(java.lang.String sequence)
                                        throws InvalidInputException
        Perform a dinucleotide shuffle.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to be shuffled.
        Returns:
        a string containing a shuffled sequence with the same dinucleotide frequency as the input.
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException

      • validSequence

        public static boolean validSequence​(java.lang.String sequence)
        Check if a nucleotide sequence only contains the letters contained in ALPHABET and is at least 2 characters long.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to be verified, must be upper case before this is called
        Returns:
        true if sequence is valid, false otherwise
